name: Healthyfied Carrot Spaghetti With Meatballs
description: Indulge in the perfect blend of health and taste with our Healthyfied Carrot Spaghetti with Meatballs recipe. This dish is a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar meal that doesn't compromise on flavor. Tailored to fit into Healthyfied and Healthy Recipes categories, it's ideal for anyone looking to enjoy classic comfort food in a nutritious way.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) for the meatballs.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the eggplant, mince the garlic, and finely chop the parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, eggplant, half of the minced garlic, half of the chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Form the mixture into small meatballs and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the meatballs for 20 minutes or until they're cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: While meatballs are baking, use a spiralizer or vegetable peeler to create carrot spaghetti from the steamed carrots.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Steam the spinach until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, sauté the remaining garlic in a little bit of oil over medium heat until fragrant, about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Add the carrot spaghetti to the pan, tossing it with the garlic for about 2-3 minutes just to warm through.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the carrot spaghetti topped with meatballs, steamed spinach, and a sprinkle of the remaining parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
